results.title: Metamorphosis: TM
results.brief_description: A colour 2D computer animation in response to the project theme of metamorphosis. A visual poem that puns on the meaning of metamorphosis…time atomises this poem. (No credits available).

results.title: [The Fridge]
results.brief_description: An ant attempts to climb to the top of the family fridge. As he scales towards the summit - dressed in his mountain climbing gear - an accident prevents him from achieving his goal. His tragic downfall is captured by photographers.

results.title: Faith the fax
results.brief_description: A platypus and his mate discuss the advantages of communicating with God. The platypus convinces his friend that forecasts from God via fax are essential for averting danger.

results.title: Silent voices
results.brief_description: Broken into three segments entitled ‘The Rape’, ‘The Miscarriage’ and ‘The Dream’, this expressionist animation poignantly conveys the emotional trauma experienced by a young woman who is sexually abused by her tyrannical father. A more fully realised version of ‘deCollage’ a shorter film by the same director

results.title: Astrozoology 101
results.brief_description: An animation using the cutout techniques pioneered by Lotte Reiniger that revises the fairytale ‘The Frog Prince’. In this version the princess is a devouring alien.

results.title: Yum yum noodles
results.creator_credit: Elena Popa, Troy Innocent, David Atkinson and John Bird
results.brief_description: Time for a bowl of something hot, wet and instant - Yum Yum noodles. Buy some today! MSG added for good tasty flavour. A parody of a noodle advertisment that comments on stereotypes of Asian cultures.

results.title: Jawpan
results.brief_description: Otaku and his robot friend Knowbot stumble across an evil force when out for a good time at th e”Nice Life” ATM. When the world is threatened with destruction by a “type 1 error”, Otaku and Knowbot must save the day by re-initialising planet earth.

results.title: This is a history of New York
results.brief_description: ‘This is a History of New York’ chronicles the seven ages of mankind from Prehistory to the Space Age. In the Age of Hunters and Gatherers, stray dogs patrol the streets while the homeless forage for food. Later in the Medieval Period, crazed street preachers pace frantically before ominous gothic architecture. The richness of Cohen’s vision is found in this haunting imagery and the perception that the thriving city of New York is really the accumulation of humanity’s failures, as well as triumphs.
